intro: Polygala vulgaris var. italiana, commonly known as the Italian milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in racemes. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers have a distinctive spurred structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
